medical_history.chief_complaint: Fatigue, weakness, weight loss, and decreased libido
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Thirteen months before presentation, the patient reported weighing 108.9 kg and began a calorie-restricted diet and aerobic exercises, resulting in a loss of 36.3 kg over 10 months. Two months prior to evaluation, symptoms included arm weakness, numbness, aching legs, decreased libido, loss of morning erections, and a faint lacy rash on his legs. Symptoms worsened with changes in exercise routine and dietary intake.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Obesity, asthma, history of submandibular abscess with drainage, and moderate hepatic siderosis. Medications include transdermal testosterone gel, gabapentin, morphine sulfate, and albuterol.
medical_history.family_history: Father had type 2 diabetes mellitus, cirrhosis, and hepatitis C virus infection; mother had anemia. No family history of autoimmune disease.
medical_history.social_history: Stopped smoking and drinking alcohol one year prior, lives with girlfriend, and owns rabbits. Receiving disability payments due to illness.
